sceneDescription.title: First Glimpse of the Living Ocean

setting.time: 22nd century, evening with dual star lighting
setting.location: Observatory deck of research station above planet Solaris
setting.weather: Vacuum of space with protective atmospheric barrier

characters.appearance: Man, early 30s, brown hair, contemplative expression, hands pressed against viewing glass
characters.position: Standing at large observation window, leaning slightly forward
characters.action: Gazing in fascination at the alien ocean below, scientific curiosity evident in attentive posture

scene.mainElements: Massive transparent viewing window, panoramic view of planet Solaris, swirling patterns of living ocean plasma creating impossible geometric formations
scene.details: Reinforced transparent aluminum window frame, soft reflections of station lights on glass surface, control panels with monitoring equipment nearby, no text or letters visible
scene.background: Vast alien ocean surface with dynamic plasma formations, dual star system casting red and blue light across planet surface, distant nebulae visible in space
scene.atmosphere: Wonder and scientific fascination, peaceful contemplation, sense of witnessing something magnificent and unprecedented, baseline curiosity before darker discoveries

composition.cameraAngle: Medium shot from behind and slightly to the side
composition.focus: Character silhouetted against the spectacular planetary view
composition.depth: Character in foreground, window frame in middle ground, vast alien ocean filling background with dynamic patterns
